title: Don't Sleep on Z Codes
description: Endorsed by the 30 state HIMAs, For The Record is the nation's leading newsmagazine for health information professionals such as Transcriptionists, Certified Medical Transcriptionists, Coding Specialists, HIM Educators, HIM Directors, HIT professionals, EHR, EMR, Information Systems Directors, and more!

title: MACRA: What you should be doing now
description: It is imperative that organizations continue to explore current-state assessments and develop a highly customized path forward to value-oriented care, adopting strategies for improving population health management.

title: Oncology Care Model Headed for Shades of Gray
description: Regardless of your politics, the motivation behind a program designed to curtail cancer costs is clear. Cancer epidemiology (the old are disproportionately affected), coupled with 21st century demography (longer life expectancy, aging boomers), means cancer costs are going up.

title: Using immunotherapy and a genetic glitch to give cancer patients hope
description: Her doctors told her there was nothing more they could do. Then Stefanie Joho connected with a small, and pivotal, clinical trial.

title: Health Care Data Analytics Powers Value-Based Reimbursement Success
description: Learn about how health care data analytics can help your organization reach its value-based reimbursement goals.

title: Op-ed: Health care reform must continue – in Utah and across America
description: Utah’s health care system can serve as an example for other states, as we all look to shift from volume-based to value-based care. For example, Intermountain Healthcare, based in Salt Lake City, is known nationwide ...

title: MACRA Likely To Cut Physicians’ Medicare Revenue | OPEN MINDS
description: By 2030, provisions of the Medicare Access And CHIP Reauthorization Act of 2015 (MACRA) are likely to reduce physician Medicare revenue. The MACRA provisions are likely to reduce physician Medicare revenue by at least 2.3% and possibly as much as 7.1% below the 2015 Medicare rates. The reductions would be due MACRA provisions for alternative payment models (APMs), which are projected to decrease Medicare spending on physician services between 2015 through 2030 by at least $35 billion. The APMs are also projected to change Medicare spending on hospital services between 2015 and 2030. The change is projected to . . . title: BREAKING: The Healthcare Informatics 100: Our Annual Ranking of Healthcare IT Vendors by Revenue
description: Click Here to View #76-#100 on the 2017 list The editors of Healthcare Informatics are once again proud to present the newest edition of our unique industry offering: the Healthcare Informatics 100 (THE 100), a compilation of the top health IT companies based on HIT revenues from the most recent fiscal year.

title: 10 Signs You Need a New Claims Management Solution - nThrive Blog
description: Your claims management solution is humming right along, helping you submit claims correctly and get reimbursements as efficiently as possible – or is it?

title: 4 questions with Billings Clinic director of patient financial services Clay Fosjord
description: As director of patient financial services at Billings (Mont.) Clinic, Clay Fosjord directs patient registration and revenue cycle operation, as well as manages accounts receivable. Prior to joining Billings Clinic, Mr. Fosjord served as director of operations for the Rocky Mountain Health Network, a Billings-based physician hospital organization.

title: Maintaining HIPAA Privacy through Increased Patient Access
description: AHIMA's Kathy Downing discusses the importance of HIPAA compliance as patients continue to use new technologies to access their own health data.

title: New Approach Helps Health Information Exchanges Cross State Lines
description: With the Patient-Centered Data Home pilot, state and regional health information exchanges can send ADT alerts across state lines.

title: nThrive CarePricer Video
description: Updates to nThrive™ CarePricer patient estimate solution includes several new features to help health care organizations better meet patient access needs. Using historical claims data, as well as provider contract and benefit information, CarePricer provides accurate patient estimates at the point of access that are within 90 percent of the final bill.

title: nThrive MACRA Management Solution
description: nThrive's MACRA management solution gives health systems the tools and knowledge needed to succeed under MACRA requirements and value-based care initiatives.
meta_description: nThrive's MACRA management solution gives health systems the tools and knowledge needed to succeed under MACRA requirements and value-based care initiatives.

title: National MT Week - Association for Healthcare Documentation Integrity
description: Association for Healthcare Documentation Integrity

title: RAND study: MACRA could cause $250B drop in hospital Medicare revenue by 2030
description: Depending on the amount of risk physicians choose to take on under the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act, hospitals' Medicare revenue could drop by $250 billion by 2030 or it could increase by $32 billion, according to a study published in Health Affairs.

title: 10 organizations urge Price to give doctors MACRA credit for Medicare Advantage advanced APMs
description: In a letter sent to HHS Secretary Tom Price on Friday, 10 groups representing physicians and payers called on Price to accelerate the movement from volume to value-based payment by adopting equitable incentives for physicians taking risk in Medicare Advantage contracts with health plans.

title: Industry Voices-The future of bundled payments
description: Since the passage of the Affordable Care Act, value-based payment models have rapidly proliferated. New initiatives and trends have revolutionized the way that healthcare systems receive payment for patient care and are emphasizing the ongoing shift away from traditional fee-for-service to value-based payments.

title: Healthcare execs expect value-based care to disrupt industry more than science in decade ahead
description: C-level executives and investors from across the healthcare industry rank pricing and reimbursement as the No. 1 strategic pressure facing the healthcare industry today, according to a survey from consulting firm Lazard.

title: Optimize revenue cycle processes and workflow to improve reimbursements
description: Kettering recognized it was experiencing an increase in underpaid accounts receivable largely due to a legacy, out-of-date contract management system, poor processes and staff productivity issues. Bad debt was increasing due to missed and late patient payments, with 55 percent coming from Medicare and Medicaid, which the legacy system did not recognize.

title: 10 top MACRA trends challenging providers
description: Physicians fear being unprepared and are looking for IT solutions to help with the transition.

title: Missing from MACRA: 2 Meaningful Use Milestones
description: The final rule implementing MACRA contains a welcome but little-noticed provision that relieves physicians of EHR-reporting burdens.
context: A couple of meaningful milestones in MACRA

title: Number of Wake Forest Baptist employees transferring to nThrive increases to 755
description: More employees of Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center than previously indicated will see their jobs move to a billing services vendor.

title: Shifting the mindset from being a hospital system to a health system
description: The seismic shift to outpatient care is affecting nearly every facet of the delivery system. Hospitals are rethinking their definition of market share, growing their clinic models and investing in telehealth.

title: Special issue of Evidence-Based Oncology focuses on benefits and challenges of APMs in cancer care
description: The revolution in how physicians will be paid brings unique challenges to cancer care, where individual patient needs may make costs hard to predict.

title: A Renewed Focus on the Critical Need for Collaboration - ICD10monitor
description: Providers, nurses, clinical care specialists, health information management (HIM) and utilization review professionals, clinical coders, and clinical...

title: Wake Forest Baptist taps nThrive for billing services: 4 things to know
description: Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center in Winston-Salem, N.C., contracted with Alpharetta, Ga.-based revenue cycle management company nThrive for professional billing services, according to a Winston-Salem Journal report.

title: How the Women and Children's Health Alliance is helping pediatricians thrive in a value-based world
description: Healthcare's evolution toward value-based care could largely impact independent physicians. To keep his independence and help other physicians do the same, Gerard M. Cleary, DO, and his neonatology group, worked with local primary care and specialty pediatricians to create the Women and Children's Health Alliance.

title: OSUMC improves performance, cash flow with nThrive Patient Access Solutions
description: OSUMC struggled with accuracy of estimates, point-of-service collections, compliance and more. They automated contract management but still needed to update patient access, charge integrity, and recovery and collections. These improvements enabled them to reorganize their preregistration and billing processes, automate patient bill estimates and eligibility verification, and train staff to ask for copays.

title: nThrive CarePricer improves accuracy
description: Because patients are taking on more of their cost of care, they want - and need - accurate estimates upfront to make informed decisions. nThrive's CarePricer estimating solution helps organizations meet this demand for higher transparency, while also increasing the likelihood of payment for co-pays and deductibles on the front end, when it is proven to be easier to collect.
